name: Ext.util.Cookies
doc: Utility class for setting/reading values from browser cookies. Values can be written using the set method. Values can be read using the get method. A cookie can be invalidated on the client machine using the clear method.

members.name: clear
members.doc: Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the past.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the cookie to remove

params.name: path
params.doc: The path for the cookie. This must be included if you included a path while setting the cookie.

members.short_doc:
Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser
if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the p...

members.name: get
members.doc:
Retrieves cookies that are accessible by the current page. If a cookie does not exist, get() returns null. The following example retrieves the cookie called "valid" and stores the String value in the variable validStatus.

var validStatus = Ext.util.Cookies.get("valid");

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the cookie to get

return.name: return
return.doc: Returns the cookie value for the specified name; null if the cookie name does not exist.

members.short_doc: Retrieves cookies that are accessible by the current page. ...

members.name: set
members.doc: Creates a cookie with the specified name and value. Additional settings for the cookie may be optionally specified (for example: expiration, access restriction, SSL).

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the cookie to set.

params.name: value
params.doc: The value to set for the cookie.

params.name: expires
params.doc: Specify an expiration date the cookie is to persist until. Note that the specified Date object will be converted to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

params.name: path
params.doc: Setting a path on the cookie restricts access to pages that match that path. Defaults to all pages ('/').

params.name: domain
params.doc: Setting a domain restricts access to pages on a given domain (typically used to allow cookie access across subdomains). For example, "sencha.com" will create a cookie that can be accessed from any subdomain of sencha.com, including www.sencha.com, support.sencha.com, etc.

params.name: secure
params.doc: Specify true to indicate that the cookie should only be accessible via SSL on a page using the HTTPS protocol. Defaults to false. Note that this will only work if the page calling this code uses the HTTPS protocol, otherwise the cookie will be created with default options.

members.short_doc: Creates a cookie with the specified name and value. ...

short_doc: Utility class for setting/reading values from browser cookies. ...
